text: There was once a man who owned several grenades in his garden. And every fall he would put the grenades in silver plates outside his home, and on the plates he would write a sign that said, "Take one for nothing". You are welcome. But people passed by without eating the fruit. Then the man pondered, and one fall he left no grenades in the silver plates outside his dwelling, but he placed a great advertisement: "We have the best grenades in the earth, but we sell them for more silver coins than any other grenade". And believe it or not, every man and woman in the neighborhood came running to buy. FIN
title: Las granadas
author: Gibrán Jalil Gibrán
